meanings.definition: Showing wild and apparently deranged excitement or energy.
meanings.sent1: The manic puppy ran around the yard in circles.
meanings.sent2: She had a manic look in her eyes as she danced wildly at the party.
meanings.sent3: The manic squirrel kept stealing all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: His manic laughter echoed through the empty halls of the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: The manic storm raged on, with lightning flashing across the sky.

meanings.definition: A person who is affected by mania.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed him as a manic after observing his behavior.
meanings.sent2: She knew she was dealing with a manic when he started talking rapidly and loudly.
meanings.sent3: The manic at the party was the center of attention with his energetic dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted a portrait of a manic with eyes full of intensity and passion.
meanings.sent5: The novel's protagonist was a manic who struggled to control his impulses.
